project_abstract.cdata: Through financing of imports and budget support the Emergency Earthquake Recovery Loan will assist Turkey to respond quickly and effectively to the impact of the devastating earthquake which hit the Marmara region on August 17, 1999. The benefits will be to provide financing for incremental private sector import needs resulting from the earthquake and for budgetary expenditures related to the recovery effort including social protection priorities. A key objective is to ensure that displaced persons and other groups made vulnerable by the earthquake receive adequate assistance particularly during the upcoming winter months, while longer-term reconstruction efforts get underway. The quick disbursing loan will provide: a) financing for a broad range of specified imports; b) financing of priority components for the earthquake recovery program (by the Government's use of the Lira counterpart of the foreign exchange proceeds); and c) limited funding for technical assistance. The loan is part of a larger assistance package from the Bank designed to complement project financing for reconstruction and disaster mitigation from the restructuring of existing projects and preparation of the Marmara Earthquake Emergency Reconstruction Project.
